required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study in Subjects With Small Primary Choroidal Melanoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1B/2 Open-Label, Ascending Single and Repeat Dose Clinical Trial Designed to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Light-activated AU-011 for the Treatment of Subjects With Small Primary Choroidal Melanoma

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective is to assess the safety, immunogenicity and efficacy of one of three dose levels and repeat dose regimens of Light-activated AU-011 and one or two laser applications for the treatment of subjects with primary choroidal melanoma.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a phase 1B/2 open-label, ascending single and repeat dose clinical trial designed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of Light-activated AU-011 for the treatment of subjects with small primary choroidal melanoma.
Throughout the study, subjects will be monitored through medical and ophthalmic assessments. Subjects will be followed for a total of 2 years.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events [Safety and Tolerability] of Light-activated AU-011
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events will be summarized by presenting the number and percentage of patients having any adverse event.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening to various time points through Week 52
Change from baseline at 3 months following treatment and at each subsequent visit through study completion (2 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Tumor size (diameter) measured by fundus photography [Efficacy]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline at 3 months following treatment and at each subsequent visit through study completion (2 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor size (diameter) measured by fundus photography (millimeters)

secondary_outcome.measure: Best Corrected Visual Acuity measured by ETDRS Method [Efficacy]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline at 3 months following treatment and at each subsequent visit through study completion (2 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in ETDRS best corrected visual acuity (BCVA)

arm_group.description: Low dose Light-activated AU-011 followed by a single laser light application
Medium dose Light-activated AU-011 followed by a single laser light application
High dose Light-activated AU-011 followed by a single laser light application
2 repeat medium doses of Light-activated AU-011 each followed by a single laser light application
3 repeat medium doses of Light-activated AU-011 followed by a single laser light application

arm_group.arm_group_label: Single High Dose Light-activated AU-011 x 2 lasers
arm_group.description: High dose Light-activated AU-011 followed by two laser light applications
3 repeat high doses of Light-activated AU-011 each followed by a single laser light application

arm_group.arm_group_label: 3 Repeat High Dose Light-activated AU-011 x 2 lasers
arm_group.description: 3 repeat high doses of Light-activated AU-011 each followed by two laser light applications

arm_group.arm_group_label: Expansion 3 Repeat High Dose Light-activated AU-011 x 2 lasers
arm_group.description: Expansion of 3 repeat high doses of Light-activated AU-011 each followed by two laser light applications (up to 12 additional subjects)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Observation until Documented Growth of Tumor
arm_group.description: Observation until documented growth of tumor and then treatment with 2 cycles each of 3 repeat high doses of Light-activated AU-011 each followed by two laser light applications

arm_group.arm_group_label: 2 Cycles of 3 Repeat High Dose Light-activated AU-011x2 lasers
arm_group.description: 2 cycles each of 3 repeat high doses of Light-activated AU-011 each followed by two laser light applications

arm_group.arm_group_label: Exp: 2 Cycles 3 Repeat High Dose Light-activatedAU-011x2lasers
arm_group.description: 2 cycles each of 3 repeat high doses of Light-activated AU-011 each followed by two laser light applications in subjects with evidence of documented tumor growth prior to study entry

intervention.arm_group_label: 2 Cycles of 3 Repeat High Dose Light-activated AU-011x2 lasers
3 Repeat High Dose Light-activated AU-011 x 2 lasers
Exp: 2 Cycles 3 Repeat High Dose Light-activatedAU-011x2lasers
Expansion 3 Repeat High Dose Light-activated AU-011 x 2 lasers
Observation until Documented Growth of Tumor
Single High Dose Light-activated AU-011 x 2 lasers

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of choroidal melanoma
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have known contraindications or sensitivities to the study drug

facility.name: Byers Eye Institute at Stanford University
W. K. Kellogg Eye Center, University of Michigan
